list_page_teaser: The law enforcement team on Twin Peaks is diverse, and they work well together.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
The law enforcement team on Twin Peaks is diverse. Agent Cooper and Sheriff Truman in particular may look at the world differently, but they share a preference for logic over emotion.

The team also works well together, with very little conflict. The images show that Lucy can be just as much of a boss as Harry is, and it is natural for Hawk and Andy to cooperate with them.

image_list.title: Dale Cooper
image_list.subtitle_html: Special Agent for the FBI
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Agent Cooper's spiritual portrait shows he is logical and highly intuitive.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Agent Cooper's dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.
The Blue in Agent Cooper's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than of facts.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Agent Cooper's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Agent Cooper's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Harry S. Truman
image_list.subtitle_html: Sheriff of the Twin Peaks Sheriffs Department
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Sheriff Truman's spiritual portrait shows he is very logical and realistic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Sheriff Truman's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Sheriff Truman's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Sheriff Truman's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in Sheriff Truman's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....

image_list.title: Tommy 'Hawk' Hill
image_list.subtitle_html: Deputy Sheriff in the Twin Peaks Sheriffs Department
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Hawk's spiritual portrait shows he is intuitive and logical, much like Agent Cooper, but not as outgoing.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Hawk's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Hawk's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
